title: Key takeaways from Sri Lanka’s CWC25 squad
byline: Here are the key talking points from Sri Lanka’s squad for the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Kuldeep stars as ’clinical’ India crush UAE in Asia Cup T20
byline: Kuldeep Yadav returned figures of 4-7 to lead holders India to a crushing nine-wicket win over hosts United Arab Emirates in their opening match of the Asia Cup on Wednesday.

title: SJB MP Prasad Siriwardana tenders apology to Govt MP
byline: Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) MP Prasad Siriwardana tendered a public apology today to government MP Lakmali Hemachandra for the rude remarks he made in Parliament yesterday.

title: Trump ally and activist Charlie Kirk shot dead at Utah university
byline: Conservative activist and Turning Point USA co-founder Charlie Kirk died Wednesday after he was shot at an event at Utah Valley University. He was 31 years old.

title: New rules to regulate vehicles transporting school children
byline: The Education Ministry has decided to introduce a new set of rules and regulations for vehicles used to transport school children.

title: Teen arrested over Borella shooting
byline: A 17-year-old boy was arrested over a shooting incident in Seewaliapura, Borella last month.

title: Engineer, rapper, mayor, now PM? Nepal’s Gen Z rallies around Balendra Shah
byline: After demonstrations forced Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign from office, all eyes are now on Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, popularly known as Balen, with online campaigns encouraging him to take the lead as the next prime minister.

title: Parliament sessions suspended for five minutes after tense situation
byline: Parliament sessions were suspended by Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne after the Opposition protested against his decision not to allow the no confidence motion against Deputy Minister Aruna Jayasekera to be debated.

title: Police most affected by non-communicable diseases: Minister
byline: Police personnel account for the highest proportion of state employees suffering from non-communicable diseases (NCDs), Health and Media Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: SriLankan Airlines resumes flights to Nepal after airport reopening
byline: SriLankan Airlines resumed its operations to Nepal today (11) with the departure of flight UL-181 from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) to Kathmandu, following the reopening of the Kathmandu International Airport by Nepal’s Civil Aviation Authority.

title: Ex-Presidents lose perks; Pensions next in line
byline: In a rare event of legislative work, a bill which was passed by Parliament was signed into Act the same day stripping former Presidents and their widows of facilities - residences, transport and secretariat allowances.

title: SL’s corporate tax collection lags regional peers, threatening fiscal recovery: WB
byline: Sri Lanka’s corporate income tax (CIT) collection remains far below the regional peers, raising concerns over the sustainability of government revenue and its post-crisis fiscal recovery, the World Bank (WB) highlighted.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with FR challenging Namal’s controversial electricity bill
byline: The Supreme Court today granted leave to proceed with a Fundamental Rights petition filed by a lawyer seeking an order directing the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to produce before Court all relevant files maintained by the CEB regarding an alleged unsettled electricity bill amounting to Rs. 2.6 million, in connection with the supply of electricity to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s residence in Weeraketiya.

title: ’Match should go on’: SC rejects plea to cancel India-Pak Asia Cup clash
byline: The Supreme Court (SC) on Thursday refused to urgently list a plea seeking cancellation of the cricket match between India and Pakistan in the upcoming Asia Cup. The match is scheduled for September 14 at Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

title: MV X-Press Pearl case: Two IT officials granted bail
byline: Two officials of Sea Consortium (Pvt) Ltd, the local representative of MV X-Prosper vessel, who were arrested on suspicion of erasing the vessel’s data system and email records following the fire onboard, were released on bail by Colombo Additional Magistrate Oshadha Migara Mahaarchchi today.

title: ’I will never quit politics’: MR
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, who left his Wijerama residence, said he will never quit politics.

title: ’’My father returns to the place where it all began’’ - Namal
byline: “My father returns to the place where it all began,” MP Namal Rajapaksa posted on X today, announcing that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has left his official residence in Colombo and returned to his hometown of Tangalle.

title: ’Chichi’ leaves Wijerama before MR
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s youngest son, Rohitha Rajapaksa, known as ’Chichi’, was seen leaving the former President’s official residence at Wijerama Road, Colombo, this afternoon (11), a moment before the former President vacated the residence.

title: Historic all-female match official panel revealed for CWC25
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) today announced a landmark moment in the history of the sport: an all-female Emirates ICC Panel of Match Officials will oversee the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: Soft power, strong future: Why Sri Lanka’s story matters
byline: There is something magical about Westminster on a crisp London evening. Last week, as I walked past the historic buildings glowing in the soft light, I felt the hum of global conversations taking place all around me.

title: Alms giving held in memory of Ella bus accident victims
byline: An almsgiving ceremony for the Maha Sangha was held yesterday at the 15th kilometre post in Rawanaella, along the Ella–Wellawaya Road, in memory of the 15 passengers who lost their lives in the recent fatal bus accident. The event also sought blessings for the speedy recovery of the injured still undergoing treatment.

title: Bribery Commission arrests former UDA officials
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested two former senior officials of the Urban Development Authority (UDA).

title: Police announces fees for public services
byline: The Sri Lanka Police has released the updated fees for services provided to the public. Obtaining Police Clearance Reports for overseas travel and related real-time services will cost Rs. 5,000.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa leaves official residence in Colombo
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, left his official residence on Wijerama Road, Colombo, a short while ago in adherence to the country’s law and order, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam said.

title: Iconic tusker ‘Mahasilu’ found dead in Okkampitiya
byline: A popular wild elephant known as Mahasilu was found dead in a paddy field at Ilukpitiya, Okkampitiya this morning (11).

title: Chinese Ambassador visits Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: A day after the enactment of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill, which requires former presidents to return official residences to the government, Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Qi Zhenhong, visited the official residence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Wijerama Road, Colombo, this morning.

title: Buses and vans on long routes to undergo safety certification
byline: A new regulation will soon be introduced for buses and vans used for long-distance passenger transport, Transport Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Three buses collide in Balangoda, schoolchildren among injured
byline: An accident involving three busses was reported in the Madola area of Balangoda this morning (11),  police said.

title: Foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 27.4million destroyed
byline: A stock of foreign cigarettes worth over Rs. 27.4 million, illegally imported into the country, was destroyed at the Muthurajawela Power Plant today, the Customs Department said.

title: Podi Menike derails near Badulla
byline: The Podi Menike Intercity train derailed this morning between the Hali Ela and Badulla railway stations, the Railways Department said.

title: SI arrested over links to underworld leader Padme
byline: A Sub-Inspector attached to the the Gampaha Crimes Investigation Unit has been arrested by the CID for alleged ties to underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme.

title: Politicians and foreign representatives visit Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: A group of politicians and foreign representatives visited the official residence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Wijerama Road, Colombo, this morning, amid reports that he is set to vacate the premises today.

title: Bimal calls Opposition MPs ’Lapai Sipai’
byline: A tense situation continued in Parliament after Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake called opposition MPs ’Lapai Sipai’ and opposition MPs started a protest against him.

title: Maithripala leaves official residence
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena has vacated his official residence on Hector Kobbekaduwa Mawatha, Colombo, following the enactment of the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Act, No. 18 of 2025.

title: Suspicion raised over death of 24-year-old mother
byline: Suspicion has been raised over the sudden death of a 24-year-old mother at the Monaragala District General Hospital.

title: Engineer, rapper, mayor, now PM? Nepal’s Gen Z rallies around Balendra Shah
byline: After demonstrations forced Nepal Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli to resign from office, all eyes are now on Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, popularly known as Balen, with online campaigns encouraging him to take the lead as the next prime minister.

title: Ravi grills government on CEB surplus, tariffs
byline: United National Party (UNP) MP Ravi Karunanayake raised several concerns in Parliament regarding the management of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) and the Government’s future energy policy.
